Ancestral repeats pipeline¶

Author:Andreas Heger
Release:$Id: pipeline_ancestral_repeats.py 2876 2010-03-27 17:42:11Z andreas $
Date:April 02, 2014
Tags:Python

The ancestral repeats pipeline defines ancestral repeats for a pair of genomes and computes rates for these.

This pipeline performs the following actions:

  • collect repeatmasker annotation from external databases. Currently implemented are:
    • UCSC
    • Ensembl

  • build pairwise genomic alignment from axt or maf files

  • define ancestral repeats

  • compute rates of ancestral repeats

Usage¶

See Setting up a pipeline and Running a pipeline on general information how to use CGAT pipelines.

Configuration¶

The pipeline expects a query and target genome. These should be set in the general section. For each genome there should then be section on how to obtain the repeatmasker tracks. The default configuration file gives an example.

Input¶

The pipeline starts from an empty working directory. It will collect the input data from directories specified in the configuration files.

The genomic alignment can both be build from axt formatted pairwise alignments and from maf formatted multiple alignmentns. However, the latter currently only works if the query genome is the reference species in the maf files.

This is a consequence of maf2Axt requiring that the strand of the reference species is always positive and I have not figured out how to invert maf alignments.

Note

ENSEMBL import is not thoroughly tested. maf formatted import is not thoroughly tested.

Type:

python pipeline_ancestral_repeats.py --help

for command line help.

Requirements¶

Output¶

The pipeline builds the following files:

aligned_repeats.psl.gz
psl formatted files of alignments between ancestral repeats
aligned_repeats.rates.gz
rates between ancestral repeats
alignment.psl.gz
psl formatted genomic alignment between query and target.
<query>_rates.gff.gz
gff formatted file of ancestral repeats on the query. The score field is set to the estimated substitution rate of the repeat.

Example¶

Example data is available at http://www.cgat.org/~andreas/sample_data/pipeline_ancestral_repeats.tgz. To run the example, simply unpack and untar:

wget http://www.cgat.org/~andreas/sample_data/pipeline_ancestral_repeats.tgz
tar -xvzf pipeline_ancestral_repeats.tgz
cd pipeline_ancestral_repeats
python <srcdir>/pipeline_ancestral_repeats.py make full

The example data builds ancestral repeats between human hg19:chr19 and mouse mm9:chr7.

Code¶

pipeline_ancestral_repeats.getGenomes()¶

return genome names of query and target.

pipeline_ancestral_repeats.buildSizes(infile, outfile)¶

extract size information from genomes.

pipeline_ancestral_repeats.buildGenomeAlignment(infiles, outfile)¶

build pairwise genomic aligment from axt files.

pipeline_ancestral_repeats.importRepeatsFromUCSC(infile, outfile, ucsc_database, repeattypes, genome)¶

import repeats from a UCSC formatted file.

The repeats are stored as a gff formatted file.

pipeline_ancestral_repeats.importRepeatsFromEnsembl(infile, outfile, ensembl_database, repeattypes, genome)¶

import repeats from an ENSEMBL database.

pipeline_ancestral_repeats.importRepeats(infile, outfile, track)¶

import repeats from external sources.

pipeline_ancestral_repeats.mergeRepeats(infile, outfile)¶

merge adjacent repeats.

pipeline_ancestral_repeats.buildAlignedRepeats(infiles, outfile)¶

build alignment between repeats.

pipeline_ancestral_repeats.buildRepeatsRates(infile, outfile)¶

compute rates for individual aligned repeats.

pipeline_ancestral_repeats.computeAlignmentStats(infile, outfile)¶

compute alignment coverage statistics

pipeline_ancestral_repeats.computeRepeatsCounts(infile, outfile)¶

count number and type of repeats.

pipeline_ancestral_repeats.buildRepeatDistribution(infile, outfile)¶

count size and distance distribution of repeats.

pipeline_ancestral_repeats.exportRatesAsGFF(infile, outfile)¶

export gff file with rate as score.

pipeline_ancestral_repeats.build_report()¶

build report from scratch.

pipeline_ancestral_repeats.update_report()¶

update report.

pipeline_ancestral_repeats.publish_report()¶

publish report.
